>From some final stronghold of sanity and evaluative clarity the rational Paul Sheldon had thought: She looks like a widow who just got cute after a ten-year dry spell. "Yes, Paul could suddenly see it - and in an instinctive way he understood exactly how such a scene, absurdly melodramatic as it might be, could be milked for suspense.
